review: Game so unbelievably powercrept. One death = team fight loss and probably game loss. Devs don't understand this and continue to set spawn rooms as far away from the objective as possible such as push and whatever the hell the new game mode is called. At least 6v6 the better team would win, but now the matchmaking and ranking is so bad that the worse team ends up winning and if the skill gap is too large in 2 teams then there's no forfeit button leading to 10+ minutes of wasted time. (Biased opinion: Get rid of a dps and bring back tank duos)

As someone who played the original Overwatch beta all those years ago and bought it on release (even got the physical origins edition) its sad to see the state the game has been left in. Overwatch 1 was a great game for probably about its first two years and then Blizzard went really hard into competitive and esports when the game is the most fun in a casual environment. Then they decided to kill Overwatch 1 for this sequel which is really nothing more than a larger sized update. They have added basically nothing new except micro-transactions and questionable balance changes. Sadly they have also removed any sort of way to play the original. I hope one day fans can make some sort of way to play Overwatch 1 in its early years again. 

At least Mei is still cute.
A pity shadow of once good game

Prepare to the story people!

Once upon a time there was a dev studio called Blizzard that was praised for the quality of their games, then they created a game that was a sucessor for TF2 and was a blast, everyone loved but that's when everything started to go sour. When they announced Overwatch they promised a pve / pvp game and many people really wanted to play both, but because of the popularity of the pvp they discarded the pve and all the ideas that made many join this game were just forgotten.

For  years overwatch was one of the greatest arena shooters but because of many bad decisions of the developing team the game was losing its own beloved player base, with numbers going down they announced a new game, yes a SECOND OVERWATCH! People got hyped, old promises were renewed, things that they said were going to be on the first game would appear in the second! The comunity was hyped until the release of the so called OVERWATCH 2.

What a disappointment, the game was the same with one less hero at each team, old maps recycled and few new additions to this "new game", but people still have faith that one of the most expected contents would be available, unfortunately it was not. The game was released without a pve....again, but the promise was there, then months passing, skins recycled, a battle pass that don't reward enough those who buy, not even letting they buy the pass again if they complete, stagnant the game start to lose players again.

THEN THE UNEXPECTED! not really....they announced that the pve mode was discarded to not even a month after the statement bring a really bad pve mode that people need to PAY separately to play it and now with the player going down more and more they released the game on steam in hopes that people play more and pay their ridiculous products and etc.

The end.
Paladins and TF2 better. Also where is PvE?

æš´é›ªä»€ä¹ˆæ—¶å€™äº–

Overwatch 2: Because One Heroic Fiasco Wasn't Enough"

Well, well, well, Overwatch is back, and this time they've doubled down on the chaos and confusion with Overwatch 2. Because apparently, saving the world once just wasn't challenging or ridiculous enough. If you thought the original Overwatch was a symphony of absurdity, get ready for a sequel that's more like a cacophony of "Wait, what just happened?"

Let's start with the graphics. The heroes now look so detailed that you can count the pixels in Hanzo's scowl as he tries to hit a target smaller than his ego. The level of realism is truly breathtaking, especially when Reaper dramatically throws his guns on the ground like a petulant teenager who just lost a Fortnite match.

But don't worry, the hero designs are still as sensible as ever. We've got heroes with hair so gravity-defying that I'm convinced Winston's been secretly selling them anti-gravity hair gel. And let's not forget the armor. I mean, who needs practical armor when you can strut into battle wearing a feather boa and call it a "tactical advantage"?

Game modes? Oh boy, they've outdone themselves. Push mode is like trying to coordinate a team of caffeinated squirrels, all hopped up on energy drinks and sugar. And the new "Escort the Payload While Juggling Watermelons" mode is a masterpiece of confusion, leading you to question whether you're playing a shooter or auditioning for a circus act.

Now, the PvE story mode is where things get truly "insightful." It's like the writers gathered in a room, threw darts at a board covered in random story clichÃ©s, and decided to run with whatever stuck. I mean, who could forget the heartwarming moment when Winston and Roadhog bonded over their mutual love of ham sandwiches? Truly Shakespearean.

And don't even get me started on the voice lines. From Tracer's unforgettable proclamation, "Cheers, love! The cavalry's here!" to Genji's deep philosophical question, "If a ninja falls in a forest and no one's around to hear it, does he make a sound?"â€”the voice lines are a testament to the poetic genius of Overwatch's writing team.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a masterclass in how to take a perfectly functional game, crank up the insanity dial to eleven, and then stand back to watch the fireworks of confusion explode. If you're looking for a game that'll have you questioning your life choices and the very fabric of reality, look no further. Overwatch 2: Because sometimes, more is definitely not better.

Rating: 2/5 "Eye-Rolling Emotes" â€“ It's a sequel that manages to outdo itself in the most bewildering and eyebrow-raising ways possible.
It was better when it was buy to play. But it's still a good game.

There are sequels that are better than the original.
There are sequels that are as good as the original.
There are sequels that are worse than the original.
There are sequels that copy the original and add content to it
and there are sequels that copy the original, remove content, change the shop to make more money, delete the original to not have any competition, and don't deliver on their promises for the early access game.

Overwatch 2 is a sequel that suits the last of those named.

Hey, if you like this game, keep playing it until it is over. The game truly is on its downfall, so I say just enjoy it while it is still up :).

The game is damn good and I do believe it is better than TF2 (sorry for being unbased!!). But this is what happens when you promise the world and then deliver... well I would have used a fancy expression, but they truly delivered nothing.

All I can say is: have fun while you still can, you better believe I will be doing this instead of dooming about the inevitable.

PS: From personal experience ranging all the way back from my Fortnite days, do not give money for microtrasnactions, PLEASE. You have no idea how stress free my life has been without spending anything. Please just go out and play some snooker or visit a public pool with the money instead.

Lame ass fucking game. 
I used to love playing it a long time ago, that's why it sucks to see its current state.
It seems as if the more characters they add, the more Blizzard fucks things up. The balance is an endless rabbit hole that I won't even bother explaining with anything other than "It's dogshit". 
Though I love the art style, characters have so many flashy abilities that, in less than 5 minutes in-game, my screen is a visual clusterfuck, where I don't even know what the fuck is going on. What dealt so much damage to me? Why couldn't I kill an enemy that I was shooting for 10 seconds straight? Who's healing me? Who's healing them? What the fuck even killed me?
Cosmetics are overpriced as all hell. Microtransactions in this game are ass, even the Battlepass that takes a million years to level up.
Don't bother with this game.
Blizzard.
Well deserved lizzard. The game itself could be a lot of fun but fuck Llizzard's scummy greedy bullshit.

Sigue siendo overwatch 1  , Ãºnicamente pusieron el  "2" para intentar revivir el juego .

- No cumplieron con nada de lo prometido a los jugadores y cancelaron todo lo que iba a diferenciar Overwatch 2 .

Muchisimas  "skins" que antes eran gratuitas en overwatch 1 y se podiÃ¡n conseguir muy fÃ¡cil jugando  ,  ahora en Overwatch 2 son de pago y conseguir algo gratuito es bastante mÃ¡s lento y muy poca cosa .
(Para los nuevos jugadores es una pu.tada)  .

La " Ãºnica skin "  , decente y trabajada que sacaron en Overwatch 2 , fue el "Genji samurai calavera" en su lanzamiento  , todo lo que han sacado despuÃ©s no vale nada , parece que quieren seguir ganando dinero con el mÃ­nimo esfuerzo y mÃ­nimo interÃ©s por su juego .

EstÃ¡n usando un modelo de pase de batalla muy agresivo y sin aportar mucho para que se compre con la mayoria de skins muy cutres , que esperan ?

Siguen sin arreglar las voces de los personajes a su idioma correspondiente , muchas veces tendrÃ¡s el juego en tu idioma ,  pero siguen hablando en inglÃ©s en muchas ocasiones o conversaciones mixtas entre distintos idiomas .

Los servidores siguen teniendo problemas , algunas partidas se desconectan , o se reinicia la partidas desde 0 , con los mismos jugadores , esto sigue estando desde su lanzamiento , aunque con menor frecuencia , pero siguen pasando .

"Lo Ãºnico bueno que puedo decir" , es que ya no se necesita el launcher de Battlenet al menos para este juego  ,  OJALA traigan todos los demÃ¡s juegos a Steam incluyendo Diablo 4 , mudando todos los logros etc a Steam y podamos olvidarnos totalmente de Battlenet .

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Blizzard Entertainment   "era" buena compaÃ±Ã­a   , pero en cuanto llego "ActivisiÃ³n"  jodie.ron todo y poco a poco fue a la decadencia y perdiÃ³ todo el renombre y la confianza de los jugadores que adorabamos la antigua Blizzard .

Tampoco creo que cambie la cosa , con la compra de Blizzard por parte Microsoft  , todas las buenas compaÃ±ias que fueron compradas por Microsoft , han desaparecido y se perdieron estudios que haciÃ¡n muy buenos juegos .

Es lo que tiene "sacar juegos para los accionistas"  y no para los jugadores a los que "en teorÃ­a" van destinados ...

Cuando solo miran por los inversores , y los jugadores pasan a un segundo plano...   , luego vienen las sorpresas de que no obtienen los ingresos que esperaban y las prisas por expandirse en este caso a Steam .

Quieren seguir ganando dinero con la ley del mÃ­nimo esfuerzo como Overwatch 
o el "copia y pega" de los Call of Duty .

El ansia desmedida por el dinero a destrozado los juegos de lo que era Blizzard .

Todo lo malo de "World of Warcraft" , tambiÃ©n llego con ActivisiÃ³n , recortes de contenido , simplificar todo muchisimo ,  compra de dinero del juego por dinero real .... en un MMO es imperdonable ... y en un mmo de cuota mensual.. no puedo poner lo que pienso ...

Destruyeron y prosti.tuyeron uno de los mejores mmo como era WoW con mucha interacciÃ³n social , se olvidaron y abandonaron todo el mundo , importando solo la expansiÃ³n actual y lo convirtieron en un simulador de colas a mazmorra dejando el personaje aparcado en las ciudades esperando... , algunos cambios de historia (lore) sin sentido y cooperaciÃ³n forzada entre facciones contrarias para jugar juntos por la falta de jugadores causada por ellos mismos y lo que han hecho con WoW .

Eso se refleja en la cantidad abismal de jugadores que han perdido y sobre todo la perdida de jugadores mÃ¡s veteranos .

Si tuviera que describir todo pienso de ActivisiÃ³n en una palabra  seria   "asco"  , por decirlo de una manera suave .

Que desgracia para los jugadores fue la llegada de Activision ...
